{{Wireless embedded system |brand=AirMagnet |model=SmartEdge Sensor Sensor4-R2S1-E |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=06/21/2012 |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=802.11 monitoring device,spectrum analyzer |fcc_id=RD7-SENSOR4X |ic_id=7491A-SENSOR4X |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=0.65 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe=af |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed=1.8 GHz |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=512 |fla1_brand=Samsung |fla1_model=K9F4G08U0D-SCB0 |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand=Micron |ram1_model= |ram1_num=2 |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model= |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_none=true |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=Marvell |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= |default_ch= }} "3988560 NG5 3001 REV 003" appears to be silkscrened on both sides of the board.
This FCC ID covers the entire '''Sensor4''' series. See the FCC manual for details on individual models..
This particular unit is using two '''Atheros''' Mini PCIe modules and a '''bandspeed''' spectrum analyzer chip ('''AirMaestro''' BSP2500?) + what appears to be an '''Airoha''' RFIC.
